Oakland Family Services
March 15 at 5:00 PM ·

The Pontiac community is pulling together in response to the coronavirus crisis and school closures. If your family is experiencing food insecurity, you are not in this alone. Please see the list of resources below from Pontiac Community Foundation.

The Baldwin Center | Micah 6 Community | Sprout Fresh Food Store | Lighthouse | Dream Center of Pontiac | Woodside Bible Church Pontiac | All Saints' Episcopal Church - Pontiac, MI | Pontiac Youth Recreation & Enrichment Center | Robert Bowens Senior Center | Ruth Peterson Senior Center | Pontiac School District | Oakland Livingston Human Service Agency (OLHSA) | Waterford School District

Oakland County Sheriff's Office
March 13 at 4:59 PM ·

Saturday, March 14, beginning at Noon, the Sheriff's Office, in partnership with Variety Feeds Kids, and Meijer, will be distributing 1300 bags of food to Pontiac residents. Residents must drive to the Pontiac substation at 110 E. Pike St. in Pontiac and stay in their cars.

post_text:
Dear Life Skills Center of Pontiac Families,
I am sure you are aware, last night, Governor Whitmer ordered the closure of all K-12 school buildings starting Monday, March 16 until Sunday, April 5, 2020. School buildings are scheduled to reopen on Monday, April 6, 2020. The Governor’s actions are an effort to slow the spread of Coronavirus COVID-19 in Michigan.

Effective immediately, Life Skills Center of Pontiac will be closed to comply with the Governor’s orders.

Look for further updated information via mail.

Thank You and Be Safe.

Look for further updated information via mail.

Thank You and Be Safe.

shared_text:
Nicole Echols
July 23, 2019 at 3:42 PM ·

Oakland Family Services Early Learning Communities Parents Interacting with Infants (PIWI) is hosting a new series tomorrow, July 24, 2019 at 10:30 am until 11:45 am. Every parent will receive diapers and wipes every session. To register, please call Nicole King at 248-858-7766 Ext. 1323. You and your child will enjoy fun interaction with each other that will support bonding time and learning. This program is for parents with children newborn up to 2 1/2 years of age. Come join the fun!
